article_text:
Since declaring her candidacy for president, Hillary Clinton has “cleared a couple of important hurdles,” Ben LaBolt, President Obama’s 2012 campaign press secretary, tells USA Today. “The first is, showing that she’s relatable and down to earth.”

Politico’s Jack Shafer has rather a different view:

What the press still fails to appreciate about Hillary Clinton is that she’s not running for president, she’s running as president, and all the usual rules about when and how she should speak don’t apply to her. In her...

article_summary:
Since declaring her candidacy for president, Hillary Clinton has “cleared a couple of important hurdles,” Ben LaBolt, President Obama’s 2012 campaign press secretary, tells USA Today.
“The first is, showing that she’s relatable and down to earth.”Politico’s Jack Shafer has rather a different view:What the press still fails to appreciate about Hillary Clinton is that she’s not running for president, she’s running as president, and all the usual rules about when and how she should speak don’t apply to her.
